metaDescription: Exclusif 6-bedroom villa in prestigious Las Rotas, Denia. Sea views, sophisticated design. €1,850,000. Contact us today for private viewing.
heroIntro: Welcome to an exceptional opportunity to acquire a prestigious 6-bedroom villa in the exclusive Las Rotas enclave of Denia, one of Costa Blanca's most sought-after coastal destinations. This sophisticated property, priced at €1,850,000, represents a compelling investment for discerning buyers seeking both luxury and financial prudence. Positioned within the coveted Las Rotas neighbourhood, this villa offers commanding sea views that epitomise Mediterranean sophistication. The property's competitive pricing at Denia's average market rate of €2,500/m² positions it favourably within the luxury segment, particularly when compared to equivalent properties along the Costa Brava, where prices command a 35% premium. For international buyers pursuing a prestigious Costa Blanca residence, this villa delivers the rare combination of exclusivity, desirable location, and authentic value. The Las Rotas area is renowned for its refined atmosphere, attracting successful professionals and investors from across Europe who appreciate quality living environments and strong rental potential.
areaSection: Denia, situated on the northern tip of the Marina Baja region, occupies a unique geographical position where the Mediterranean Sea meets the dramatic headland of Cabo de San Antonio. The town combines authentic Spanish coastal character with sophisticated European infrastructure, making it distinct from more commercialised Costa Blanca destinations. Blessed with over 300 days of annual sunshine and temperate winters, Denia's climate supports the cultivation of local specialities, particularly red prawns (gambas rojas) that define its culinary identity. The town's strategic location provides proximity to both Ibiza and Valencia, whilst maintaining a refined, less-crowded atmosphere than neighbouring resorts. Denia's rolling hinterland transitions from sandy beaches to dramatic rocky coves, creating diverse landscapes that appeal to both water enthusiasts and those seeking natural tranquility.
lifestyleSection: Life in Denia represents an elevated Mediterranean lifestyle characterised by cosmopolitan sophistication and authentic Spanish culture. The expat community—predominantly British, German, Dutch, and French—has established excellent English-language infrastructure, world-class healthcare facilities with English-speaking practitioners, and international schooling options that cater to families. Residents enjoy daily rituals at the bustling local fish market, weekly farmers' markets showcasing regional produce, and an exceptional dining scene ranging from traditional tapas bars to Michelin-recognized restaurants. The town's beautiful beaches—from the sandy Las Marinas to the dramatic rocky coves of Les Rotes—provide year-round recreation, whilst proximity to three championship golf courses (La Sella, Oliva Nova, and Jávea Golf) satisfies sporting pursuits. The thriving expat community hosts cultural events, social clubs, and business networking opportunities, creating a welcoming environment for international residents seeking both community and privacy.
investmentSection: From an investment perspective, this villa occupies an exceptionally favourable position within Costa Blanca's property market. The region demonstrates consistent annual appreciation of 7%, reflecting sustained demand from international investors and owner-occupiers. Comparable properties in Las Rotas command premium valuations due to location scarcity and sea-view premiums. The local rental market supports strong income generation, with similar 6-bedroom villas achieving €900+ per week during peak seasons, generating annual rental yields of 18-22% for owner-investors. Denia's position as a primary expatriate destination—with established communities of wealthy British, German, and Dutch nationals—ensures consistent demand for premium seasonal and long-term lets. The competitive pricing of this property relative to the Denia average of €2,500/m² provides entry-level access to the luxury segment, particularly advantageous given the region's 7% year-on-year appreciation. Long-term capital appreciation, coupled with revenue-generating rental potential, positions this villa as a strategic acquisition for discerning investors.
conclusion: This exceptional 6-bedroom villa in Las Rotas represents a rare opportunity to acquire a prestigious Mediterranean property combining luxury lifestyle, investment potential, and authentic value. The combination of commanding sea views, exclusive location, proven rental income capacity, and competitive pricing creates compelling appeal for discerning international buyers. Whether seeking a sophisticated personal residence, investment portfolio diversification, or Mediterranean lifestyle transition, this property delivers the rare intersection of quality, location, and financial prudence. The established expatriate community, world-class amenities, and consistent market appreciation position Denia as a strategically superior choice within Costa Blanca. Take advantage of Costa Blanca's 7% annual appreciation and Denia's leading growth trajectory. Contact our team via WhatsApp for a confidential consultation, private viewings, and comprehensive legal guidance. Your Mediterranean opportunity awaits.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle un bon endroit pour acheter un bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent property investment destination. The region demonstrates consistent 7% year-on-year appreciation, with Denia leading growth trends. Established expatriate communities, world-class infrastructure, and Mediterranean lifestyle quality make it particularly attractive for international investors seeking both personal use and rental income opportunities. The region offers superior value compared to neighbouring Costa Brava, where equivalent properties command 35% higher prices.

faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. EU citizens enjoy equivalent rights to Spanish nationals, whilst non-EU citizens require only a Spanish tax identification number (NIE). The purchase process involves standard legal documentation, property surveys, and notarial registration. Most international buyers employ English-speaking solicitors familiar with foreign ownership procedures, ensuring smooth transactions.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, Spanish property acquisition involves transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (€1,000-3,000), property registry fees (approximately €200-400), and legal fees (1-2% of purchase price). Denia's location in Valencia region applies 7% transfer tax. Total acquisition costs typically range from 8-12% above purchase price. Obtain detailed cost breakdowns from your legal advisor before committing.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, most major Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign nationals with permanent residency, NIE registration, or documented Spanish income. Typical mortgage terms provide 70-80% loan-to-value ratios across 20-30 year periods. Interest rates are competitive with European averages. UK and international investors often arrange cross-border mortgages through specialised lenders familiar with foreign buyer circumstances.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Denia is significantly lower than Northern Europe. Monthly expenses for a couple range from €1,500-2,500 for comfortable living, including utilities, dining, and entertainment. Healthcare is affordable with private insurance costing €150-300 monthly. International schools cost €5,000-12,000 annually. Expatriate communities report that quality Mediterranean lifestyle costs substantially less than equivalent UK or Northern European locations.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle adaptée aux retraités ?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is exceptional for retirees, combining affordable living costs, world-class healthcare, established expatriate communities, and Mediterranean lifestyle quality. Denia specifically attracts retirees seeking cultural sophistication, excellent restaurants, and activity-rich environments. Spanish residence permits accommodate retirees with modest income requirements, whilst healthcare coverage equals European standards. Many retirees note improved quality of life compared to Northern Europe at substantially reduced costs.

faqs.question: À quelle distance se trouve la Costa Blanca de la France ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is approximately 1,300km from London, accessible by direct flights from Alicante Airport in 2 hours 15 minutes. Frequent daily services from major UK airports (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol) make visiting friends and family convenient. Many international property owners maintain regular UK connections whilst enjoying Mediterranean residency. Budget airlines provide affordable options for regular transatlantic travel.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine with mild winters and warm summers. Average temperatures range from 10°C in winter to 28°C in summer, rarely reaching extremes. Rainfall is concentrated in autumn and spring, with summers typically dry. The climate supports year-round outdoor activities, Mediterranean gardening, and comfortable indoor-outdoor living. Winter temperatures rarely require heating beyond occasional use, reducing energy costs compared to Northern Europe.

faqs.question: What rental income can I expect from a villa like this?
faqs.answer: Comparable 6-bedroom villas in Las Rotas achieve €900+ per week during peak seasons (May-September), generating €4,500-5,500 monthly during premium periods. Off-season rates typically range €600-800 weekly. Professional management generates estimated annual rental income of €35,000-45,000 for well-maintained properties in premium locations. This supports 18-22% annual yields, making such properties attractive for investment-focused buyers alongside personal use.

faqs.question: What makes Las Rotas special compared to other Denia locations?
faqs.answer: Las Rotas represents Denia's most exclusive and prestigious neighbourhood, distinguished by direct Mediterranean access, dramatic rocky coves, sophisticated resident community, and commanding sea views. Properties here command premium valuations due to location scarcity, privacy, and lifestyle quality. The neighbourhood attracts successful professionals and investors prioritising exclusivity and natural beauty, creating a refined atmosphere distinct from more commercial coastal areas.
